snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry was in Rome seeking to advance a Russian-American proposal for a Syrian peace conference to begin within a month.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry announces new diplomatic effort with Russia to end two-year-old Syrian conflict; telephones leaders in Europe and Middle East to lay groundwork for conference between rebels and Syrian government, sponsored by United States and Russia.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers reported from Rome, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Anne Barnard, Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry was in Rome seeking to advance a Russian-American proposal for a Syrian peace conference to begin within a month.

headline.seo: As Syria Diplomacy Gains, Kerry to Announce More Aid
headline.main: New Diplomatic Push to End Civil War in Syria
headline.print_headline: New Diplomatic Push to End Civil War in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
